cwe.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Data Transmission Without Encryption
cwe.description: Information sent over a network can be compromised while in transit. An attacker may be able to read or modify the contents if the data are sent in plaintext or are weakly encrypted.

cwe.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Insufficient Session-ID Length
cwe.description: The J2EE application is configured to use an insufficient session ID length.

cwe.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Missing Custom Error Page
cwe.description: The default error page of a web application should not display sensitive information about the product.

cwe.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Entity Bean Declared Remote
cwe.description: When an application exposes a remote interface for an entity bean, it might also expose methods that get or set the bean's data. These methods could be leveraged to read sensitive information, or to change data in ways that violate the application's expectations, potentially leading to other vulnerabilities.

cwe.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Weak Access Permissions for EJB Methods
cwe.description: If elevated access rights are assigned to EJB methods, then an attacker can take advantage of the permissions to exploit the product.

cwe.name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Creating Debug Binary
cwe.description: Debugging messages help attackers learn about the system and plan a form of attack.

cwe.name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Missing Custom Error Page
cwe.description: An ASP .NET application must enable custom error pages in order to prevent attackers from mining information from the framework's built-in responses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Missing Custom Error Handling

cwe.name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Password in Configuration File
cwe.description: Storing a plaintext password in a configuration file allows anyone who can read the file access to the password-protected resource making them an easy target for attackers.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Password in Configuration File

cwe.name: Compiler Removal of Code to Clear Buffers
cwe.description: Sensitive memory is cleared according to the source code, but compiler optimizations leave the memory untouched when it is not read from again, aka "dead store removal."

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sensitive memory uncleared by compiler optimization
Be aware of compiler optimization when dealing with sensitive data

cwe.name: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
cwe.description: One or more system settings or configuration elements can be externally controlled by a user.

cwe.name: Improper Input Validation
cwe.description: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Prefer functions that support error checking over equivalent functions that don't
Exclude user input from format strings
Define and use a pointer validation function

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside of the restricted directory.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Canonicalize path names originating from untrusted sources
Canonicalize path names before validating them

cwe.name: Relative Path Traversal
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize sequences such as ".." that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '../filedir'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize "../" sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '/../filedir'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize "/../" sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '/dir/../filename'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize "/dir/../filename" sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: 'dir/../../filename'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize multiple internal "../" sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '..\filedir'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize "..\" sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '\..\filename'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '\..\filename' (leading backslash dot dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '\dir\..\filename'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '\dir\..\filename' (leading backslash dot dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: 'dir\..\..\filename'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize 'dir\..\..\filename' (multiple internal backslash dot dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '...' (Triple Dot)
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '...' (triple dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '....' (Multiple Dot)
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '....' (multiple dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '....//'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '....//' (doubled dot dot slash) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '.../...//'
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '.../...//' (doubled triple dot slash) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Absolute Path Traversal
cwe.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize absolute path sequences such as "/abs/path" that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '/absolute/pathname/here'
cwe.description: The product accepts input in the form of a slash absolute path ('/absolute/pathname/here') without appropriate validation, which can allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '\absolute\pathname\here'
cwe.description: The product accepts input in the form of a backslash absolute path ('\absolute\pathname\here') without appropriate validation, which can allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Path Traversal: 'C:dirname'
cwe.description: The product accepts input that contains a drive letter or Windows volume letter ('C:dirname') that potentially redirects access to an unintended location or arbitrary file.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Path Traversal: '\\UNC\share\name\' (Windows UNC Share)
cwe.description: The product accepts input that identifies a Windows UNC share ('\\UNC\share\name') that potentially redirects access to an unintended location or arbitrary file.

cwe.name: Improper Resolution of Path Equivalence
cwe.description: The product is vulnerable to file system contents disclosure through path equivalence. Path equivalence involves the use of special characters in file and directory names. The associated manipulations are intended to generate multiple names for the same object.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Canonicalize path names originating from untrusted sources

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filename.' (Trailing Dot)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of trailing dot ('filedir.') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filename....' (Multiple Trailing Dot)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple trailing dot ('filedir....') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'file.name' (Internal Dot)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of internal dot ('file.ordir') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'file...name' (Multiple Internal Dot)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple internal dot ('file...dir') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filename ' (Trailing Space)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of trailing space ('filedir ') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: ' filename' (Leading Space)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of leading space (' filedir') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'file name' (Internal Whitespace)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of internal space ('file(SPACE)name') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filename/' (Trailing Slash)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of trailing slash ('filedir/') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: '//multiple/leading/slash'
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple leading slash ('//multiple/leading/slash') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: '/multiple//internal/slash'
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple internal slash ('/multiple//internal/slash/') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: '/multiple/trailing/slash//'
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple trailing slash ('/multiple/trailing/slash//') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: '\multiple\\internal\backslash'
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple internal backslash ('\multiple\trailing\\slash') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filedir\' (Trailing Backslash)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of trailing backslash ('filedir\') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: '/./' (Single Dot Directory)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of single dot directory exploit ('/./') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'filedir*' (Wildcard)
cwe.description: The product accepts path input in the form of asterisk wildcard ('filedir*') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: 'fakedir/../realdir/filename'
cwe.description: The product contains protection mechanisms to restrict access to 'realdir/filename', but it constructs pathnames using external input in the form of 'fakedir/../realdir/filename' that are not handled by those mechanisms. This allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions against the targeted file.

cwe.name: Path Equivalence: Windows 8.3 Filename
cwe.description: The product contains a protection mechanism that restricts access to a long filename on a Windows operating system, but it does not properly restrict access to the equivalent short "8.3" filename.

cwe.name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
cwe.description: The product attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Canonicalize path names originating from untrusted sources
Check for the existence of links when dealing with files
Do not operate on files that can be modified by untrusted users

cwe.name: UNIX Symbolic Link (Symlink) Following
cwe.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently account for when the file is a symbolic link that resolves to a target outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

cwe.name: UNIX Hard Link
cwe.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently account for when the name is associated with a hard link to a target that is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Windows Shortcut Following (.LNK)
cwe.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently handle when the file is a Windows shortcut (.LNK) whose target is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Windows Hard Link
cwe.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently handle when the name is associated with a hard link to a target that is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Identify files using multiple file attributes

cwe.name: Improper Handling of File Names that Identify Virtual Resources
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles a file name that identifies a "virtual" resource that is not directly specified within the directory that is associated with the file name, causing the product to perform file-based operations on a resource that is not a file.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Windows Device Names
cwe.description: The product constructs pathnames from user input, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles a pathname containing a Windows device name such as AUX or CON. This typically leads to denial of service or an information exposure when the application attempts to process the pathname as a regular file.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not perform operations on devices that are only appropriate for files
Do not operate on files in shared directories
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Windows ::DATA Alternate Data Stream
cwe.description: The product does not properly prevent access to, or detect usage of, alternate data streams (ADS).

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Apple '.DS_Store'
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated as it represents a specific observed example of a UNIX Hard Link weakness type rather than its own individual weakness type. Please refer to CWE-62.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Apple HFS+ Alternate Data Stream Path
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle special paths that may identify the data or resource fork of a file on the HFS+ file system.

cwe.name: External Control of File Name or Path
cwe.description: The product allows user input to control or influence paths or file names that are used in filesystem operations.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of a command, data structure, or record using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify how it is parsed or interpreted when it is sent to a downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Injection problem ('data' used as something else)

cwe.name: Failure to Sanitize Special Elements into a Different Plane (Special Element Injection)
cwe.description: The product does not adequately filter user-controlled input for special elements with control implications.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Equivalent Special Elements
cwe.description: The product correctly neutralizes certain special elements, but it improperly neutralizes equivalent special elements.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not pass untrusted, unsanitized data to a command interpreter

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sanitize the environment when invoking external programs
Sanitize data passed to complex subsystems
Do not pass untrusted, unsanitized data to the Runtime.exec() method
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special characters such as " ", and "&" that could be interpreted as web-scripting elements when they are sent to a downstream component that processes web pages.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in an Error Message Web Page
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special characters that could be interpreted as web-scripting elements when they are sent to an error page.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in Attributes of IMG Tags in a Web Page
cwe.description: The web application does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes scripting elements within attributes of HTML IMG tags, such as the src attribute.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in Attributes in a Web Page
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes "javascript:" or other URIs from dangerous attributes within tags, such as onmouseover, onload, onerror, or style.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Encoded URI Schemes in a Web Page
cwe.description: The web application improperly neutralizes user-controlled input for executable script disguised with URI encodings.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: XSS using Script Via Encoded URI Schemes

cwe.name: Doubled Character XSS Manipulations
cwe.description: The web application does not filter user-controlled input for executable script disguised using doubling of the involved characters.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: DOUBLE - Doubled character XSS manipulations, e.g. "<script"

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Invalid Characters in Identifiers in Web Pages
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes invalid characters or byte sequences in the middle of tag names, URI schemes, and other identifiers.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Alternate XSS Syntax
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controlled input for alternate script syntax.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs a string for a command to be executed by a separate component in another control sphere, but it does not properly delimit the intended arguments, options, or switches within that command string.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sanitize the environment when invoking external programs
Sanitize data passed to complex subsystems

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component. Without sufficient removal or quoting of SQL syntax in user-controllable inputs, the generated SQL query can cause those inputs to be interpreted as SQL instead of ordinary user data.

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of an LDAP query using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended LDAP query when it is sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: XML Injection (aka Blind XPath Injection)
cwe.description: The product does not properly neutralize special elements that are used in XML, allowing attackers to modify the syntax, content, or commands of the XML before it is processed by an end system.

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Improper Sanitization of Custom Special Characters
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated. It originally came from PLOVER, which sometimes defined "other" and "miscellaneous" categories in order to satisfy exhaustiveness requirements for taxonomies. Within the context of CWE, the use of a more abstract entry is preferred in mapping situations. CWE-75 is a more appropriate mapping.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences ('CRLF Injection')
cwe.description: The product uses CRLF (carriage return line feeds) as a special element, e.g. to separate lines or records, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes CRLF sequences from inputs.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes code syntax before using the input in a dynamic evaluation call (e.g. "eval").

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not invoke the eval form with a string argument

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes code syntax before inserting the input into an executable resource, such as a library, configuration file, or template.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Server-Side Includes (SSI) Within a Web Page
cwe.description: The product generates a web page, but does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input that could be interpreted as a server-side include (SSI) directive.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion')
cwe.description: The PHP application receives input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the input before its usage in "require," "include," or similar functions.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the input before it is used as an identifier for a resource that may be outside the intended sphere of control.

cwe.name: Struts: Duplicate Validation Forms
cwe.description: The product uses multiple validation forms with the same name, which might cause the Struts Validator to validate a form that the programmer does not expect.

cwe.name: Struts: Incomplete validate() Method Definition
cwe.description: The product has a validator form that either does not define a validate() method, or defines a validate() method but does not call super.validate().

cwe.name: Struts: Form Bean Does Not Extend Validation Class
cwe.description: If a form bean does not extend an ActionForm subclass of the Validator framework, it can expose the application to other weaknesses related to insufficient input validation.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Struts: Form Bean Does Not Extend Validation Class

cwe.name: Struts: Form Field Without Validator
cwe.description: The product has a form field that is not validated by a corresponding validation form, which can introduce other weaknesses related to insufficient input validation.

cwe.name: Struts: Plug-in Framework not in Use
cwe.description: When an application does not use an input validation framework such as the Struts Validator, there is a greater risk of introducing weaknesses related to insufficient input validation.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Struts: Plug-in Framework Not In Use

cwe.name: Struts: Unused Validation Form
cwe.description: An unused validation form indicates that validation logic is not up-to-date.

cwe.name: Struts: Unvalidated Action Form
cwe.description: Every Action Form must have a corresponding validation form.

cwe.name: Struts: Validator Turned Off
cwe.description: Automatic filtering via a Struts bean has been turned off, which disables the Struts Validator and custom validation logic. This exposes the application to other weaknesses related to insufficient input validation.

cwe.name: Struts: Validator Without Form Field
cwe.description: Validation fields that do not appear in forms they are associated with indicate that the validation logic is out of date.

cwe.name: Direct Use of Unsafe JNI
cwe.description: When a Java application uses the Java Native Interface (JNI) to call code written in another programming language, it can expose the application to weaknesses in that code, even if those weaknesses cannot occur in Java.

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Safely invoke standard APIs that perform tasks using the immediate caller's class loader instance (loadLibrary)
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java
SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java

cwe.name: Missing XML Validation
cwe.description: The product accepts XML from an untrusted source but does not validate the XML against the proper schema.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')
cwe.description: The product receives data from an HTTP agent/component (e.g., web server, proxy, browser, etc.), but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes CR and LF characters before the data is included in outgoing HTTP headers.

cwe.name: Process Control
cwe.description: Executing commands or loading libraries from an untrusted source or in an untrusted environment can cause an application to execute malicious commands (and payloads) on behalf of an attacker.

cwe.name: Misinterpretation of Input
cwe.description: The product misinterprets an input, whether from an attacker or another product, in a security-relevant fashion.

cwe.name: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
cwe.description: The product prepares a structured message for communication with another component, but encoding or escaping of the data is either missing or done incorrectly. As a result, the intended structure of the message is not preserved.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sanitize untrusted data passed across a trust boundary
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use a subset of ASCII for file and path names
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)
SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sanitize untrusted data passed across a trust boundary

cwe.name: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs
cwe.description: The product constructs a log message from external input, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements when the message is written to a log file.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not log unsanitized user input
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not log unsanitized user input
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java

cwe.name: Incorrect Access of Indexable Resource ('Range Error')
cwe.description: The product does not restrict or incorrectly restricts operations within the boundaries of a resource that is accessed using an index or pointer, such as memory or files.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
cwe.description: The product performs operations on a memory buffer, but it reads from or writes to a memory location outside the buffer's intended boundary. This may result in read or write operations on unexpected memory locations that could be linked to other variables, data structures, or internal program data.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts
Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers
Do not make assumptions about the size of an environment variable
Do not access a variable through a pointer of an incompatible type
Do not assume character data has been read
Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator
Do not pass a non-null-terminated character sequence to a library function that expects a string

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
cwe.description: The product copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Stack-based Buffer Overflow
cwe.description: A stack-based buffer overflow condition is a condition where the buffer being overwritten is allocated on the stack (i.e., is a local variable or, rarely, a parameter to a function).

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers
Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Heap-based Buffer Overflow
cwe.description: A heap overflow condition is a buffer overflow, where the buffer that can be overwritten is allocated in the heap portion of memory, generally meaning that the buffer was allocated using a routine such as malloc().

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Write-what-where Condition
cwe.description: Any condition where the attacker has the ability to write an arbitrary value to an arbitrary location, often as the result of a buffer overflow.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts
Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers
Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Buffer Underwrite ('Buffer Underflow')
cwe.description: The product writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location prior to the beginning of the buffer.

cwe.name: Out-of-bounds Read
cwe.description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

cwe.name: Buffer Over-read
cwe.description: The product reads from a buffer using buffer access mechanisms such as indexes or pointers that reference memory locations after the targeted buffer.

cwe.name: Buffer Under-read
cwe.description: The product reads from a buffer using buffer access mechanisms such as indexes or pointers that reference memory locations prior to the targeted buffer.

cwe.name: Wrap-around Error
cwe.description: Wrap around errors occur whenever a value is incremented past the maximum value for its type and therefore "wraps around" to a very small, negative, or undefined value.

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Array Index
cwe.description: The product uses untrusted input when calculating or using an array index, but the product does not validate or incorrectly validates the index to ensure the index references a valid position within the array.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency
cwe.description: The product parses a formatted message or structure, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles a length field that is inconsistent with the actual length of the associated data.

cwe.name: Incorrect Calculation of Buffer Size
cwe.description: The product does not correctly calculate the size to be used when allocating a buffer, which could lead to a buffer overflow.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap
Allocate sufficient memory for an object

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as control elements or syntactic markers when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Delimiters
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes delimiters.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Parameter/Argument Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as parameter or argument delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Value Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as value delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Record Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as record delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Line Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as line delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not log unsanitized user input
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Section Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as section delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Expression/Command Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as expression or command delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input Terminators
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as input terminators when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input Leaders
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when a leading character or sequence ("leader") is missing or malformed, or if multiple leaders are used when only one should be allowed.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Quoting Syntax
cwe.description: Quotes injected into a product can be used to compromise a system. As data are parsed, an injected/absent/duplicate/malformed use of quotes may cause the process to take unexpected actions.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Escape, Meta, or Control Sequences
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as escape, meta, or control character sequences when they are sent to a downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Escape, Meta, or Control Character / Sequence
Do not log unsanitized user input
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Comment Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as comment delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Macro Symbols
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as macro symbols when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Substitution Characters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as substitution characters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Variable Name Delimiters
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as variable name delimiters when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Wildcards or Matching Symbols
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as wildcards or matching symbols when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Whitespace
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as whitespace when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Failure to Sanitize Paired Delimiters
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle the characters that are used to mark the beginning and ending of a group of entities, such as parentheses, brackets, and braces.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Null Byte or NUL Character
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes NUL characters or null bytes when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Invalid Use of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product does not properly filter, remove, quote, or otherwise manage the invalid use of special elements in user-controlled input, which could cause adverse effect on its behavior and integrity.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Leading Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes leading special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Multiple Leading Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes multiple leading special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Trailing Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes trailing special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Multiple Trailing Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes multiple trailing special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Internal Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes internal special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Multiple Internal Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes multiple internal special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Missing Special Element
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles when an expected special element is missing.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Additional Special Element
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles when an additional unexpected special element is provided.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Inconsistent Special Elements
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle input in which an inconsistency exists between two or more special characters or reserved words.

cwe.name: Improper Null Termination
cwe.description: The product does not terminate or incorrectly terminates a string or array with a null character or equivalent terminator.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not inadvertently truncate a null-terminated byte string
Do not pass a non-null-terminated character sequence to a library function that expects a string

cwe.name: Encoding Error
cwe.description: The product does not properly encode or decode the data, resulting in unexpected values.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Alternate Encoding
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when an input uses an alternate encoding that is valid for the control sphere to which the input is being sent.

cwe.name: Double Decoding of the Same Data
cwe.description: The product decodes the same input twice, which can limit the effectiveness of any protection mechanism that occurs in between the decoding operations.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Mixed Encoding
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when the same input uses several different (mixed) encodings.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Unicode Encoding
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when an input contains Unicode encoding.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of URL Encoding (Hex Encoding)
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when all or part of an input has been URL encoded.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Case Sensitivity
cwe.description: The product does not properly account for differences in case sensitivity when accessing or determining the properties of a resource, leading to inconsistent results.

cwe.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Validation
cwe.description: The product validates input before applying protection mechanisms that modify the input, which could allow an attacker to bypass the validation via dangerous inputs that only arise after the modification.

cwe.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Canonicalize
cwe.description: The product validates input before it is canonicalized, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the canonicalization step.

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)
SEI CERT Oracle Coding Standard for Java

cwe.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Filter
cwe.description: The product validates data before it has been filtered, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the filtering step.

cwe.name: Collapse of Data into Unsafe Value
cwe.description: The product filters data in a way that causes it to be reduced or "collapsed" into an unsafe value that violates an expected security property.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Collapse of Data into Unsafe Value
Eliminate noncharacter code points before validation
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Permissive List of Allowed Inputs
cwe.description: The product implements a protection mechanism that relies on a list of inputs (or properties of inputs) that are explicitly allowed by policy because the inputs are assumed to be safe, but the list is too permissive - that is, it allows an input that is unsafe, leading to resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Incomplete List of Disallowed Inputs
cwe.description: The product implements a protection mechanism that relies on a list of inputs (or properties of inputs) that are not allowed by policy or otherwise require other action to neutralize before additional processing takes place, but the list is incomplete.

cwe.name: Incorrect Regular Expression
cwe.description: The product specifies a regular expression in a way that causes data to be improperly matched or compared.

cwe.name: Overly Restrictive Regular Expression
cwe.description: A regular expression is overly restrictive, which prevents dangerous values from being detected.

cwe.name: Partial String Comparison
cwe.description: The product performs a comparison that only examines a portion of a factor before determining whether there is a match, such as a substring, leading to resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Reliance on Data/Memory Layout
cwe.description: The product makes invalid assumptions about how protocol data or memory is organized at a lower level, resulting in unintended program behavior.

cwe.name: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
cwe.description: The product performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound when the logic assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than the original value. This occurs when an integer value is incremented to a value that is too large to store in the associated representation. When this occurs, the value may become a very small or negative number.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Evaluate integer expressions in a larger size before comparing or assigning to that size
Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap
Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow
Evaluate integer expressions in a larger size before comparing or assigning to that size
Ensure that the arguments to calloc(), when multiplied, do not wrap
Allocate sufficient memory for an object

cwe.name: Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound)
cwe.description: The product subtracts one value from another, such that the result is less than the minimum allowable integer value, which produces a value that is not equal to the correct result.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap
Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow

cwe.name: Integer Coercion Error
cwe.description: Integer coercion refers to a set of flaws pertaining to the type casting, extension, or truncation of primitive data types.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use input functions to convert character data if they cannot handle all possible inputs
Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data

cwe.name: Off-by-one Error
cwe.description: A product calculates or uses an incorrect maximum or minimum value that is 1 more, or 1 less, than the correct value.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Unexpected Sign Extension
cwe.description: The product performs an operation on a number that causes it to be sign extended when it is transformed into a larger data type. When the original number is negative, this can produce unexpected values that lead to resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data

cwe.name: Signed to Unsigned Conversion Error
cwe.description: The product uses a signed primitive and performs a cast to an unsigned primitive, which can produce an unexpected value if the value of the signed primitive can not be represented using an unsigned primitive.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data

cwe.name: Unsigned to Signed Conversion Error
cwe.description: The product uses an unsigned primitive and performs a cast to a signed primitive, which can produce an unexpected value if the value of the unsigned primitive can not be represented using a signed primitive.

cwe.name: Numeric Truncation Error
cwe.description: Truncation errors occur when a primitive is cast to a primitive of a smaller size and data is lost in the conversion.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Distinguish between characters read from a file and EOF or WEOF
Ensure that floating point conversions are within range of the new type
Do not use input functions to convert character data if they cannot handle all possible inputs
Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
Ensure conversions of numeric types to narrower types do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Use of Incorrect Byte Ordering
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not account for byte ordering (e.g. big-endian and little-endian) when processing the input, causing an incorrect number or value to be used.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Provide methods to read and write little-endian data
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwe.description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Information Leakage and Improper Error Handling

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data
cwe.description: The code transmits data to another actor, but a portion of the data includes sensitive information that should not be accessible to that actor.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Accidental leaking of sensitive information through sent data

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information Through Data Queries
cwe.description: When trying to keep information confidential, an attacker can often infer some of the information by using statistics.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Accidental leaking of sensitive information through data queries

cwe.name: Observable Discrepancy
cwe.description: The product behaves differently or sends different responses under different circumstances in a way that is observable to an unauthorized actor, which exposes security-relevant information about the state of the product, such as whether a particular operation was successful or not.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Information Leakage and Improper Error Handling

cwe.name: Observable Response Discrepancy
cwe.description: The product provides different responses to incoming requests in a way that reveals internal state information to an unauthorized actor outside of the intended control sphere.

cwe.name: Observable Behavioral Discrepancy
cwe.description: The product's behaviors indicate important differences that may be observed by unauthorized actors in a way that reveals (1) its internal state or decision process, or (2) differences from other products with equivalent functionality.

cwe.name: Observable Internal Behavioral Discrepancy
cwe.description: The product performs multiple behaviors that are combined to produce a single result, but the individual behaviors are observable separately in a way that allows attackers to reveal internal state or internal decision points.

cwe.name: Observable Behavioral Discrepancy With Equivalent Products
cwe.description: The product operates in an environment in which its existence or specific identity should not be known, but it behaves differently than other products with equivalent functionality, in a way that is observable to an attacker.

cwe.name: Observable Timing Discrepancy
cwe.description: Two separate operations in a product require different amounts of time to complete, in a way that is observable to an actor and reveals security-relevant information about the state of the product, such as whether a particular operation was successful or not.

cwe.name: Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The product generates an error message that includes sensitive information about its environment, users, or associated data.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Accidental leaking of sensitive information through error messages
Information Leakage and Improper Error Handling
Do not allow exceptions to expose sensitive information
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Self-generated Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The product identifies an error condition and creates its own diagnostic or error messages that contain sensitive information.

cwe.name: Externally-Generated Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The product performs an operation that triggers an external diagnostic or error message that is not directly generated or controlled by the product, such as an error generated by the programming language interpreter that a software application uses. The error can contain sensitive system information.

cwe.name: Improper Removal of Sensitive Information Before Storage or Transfer
cwe.description: The product stores, transfers, or shares a resource that contains sensitive information, but it does not properly remove that information before the product makes the resource available to unauthorized actors.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information Due to Incompatible Policies
cwe.description: The product's intended functionality exposes information to certain actors in accordance with the developer's security policy, but this information is regarded as sensitive according to the intended security policies of other stakeholders such as the product's administrator, users, or others whose information is being processed.

cwe.name: Invocation of Process Using Visible Sensitive Information
cwe.description: A process is invoked with sensitive command-line arguments, environment variables, or other elements that can be seen by other processes on the operating system.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Process information infoleak to other processes

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Debugging Code
cwe.description: The product inserts sensitive information into debugging code, which could expose this information if the debugging code is not disabled in production.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Information Leakage and Improper Error Handling

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Containment Errors (Container Errors)
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated, as it was not effective as a weakness and was structured more like a category. In addition, the name is inappropriate, since the "container" term is widely understood by developers in different ways than originally intended by PLOVER, the original source for this entry.

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Failure to Protect Stored Data from Modification
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated because it incorporated and confused multiple weaknesses. The issues formerly covered in this entry can be found at CWE-766 and CWE-767.

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Failure to provide confidentiality for stored data
cwe.description: This weakness has been deprecated because it was a duplicate of CWE-493. All content has been transferred to CWE-493.

cwe.name: Storage of File with Sensitive Data Under Web Root
cwe.description: The product stores sensitive data under the web document root with insufficient access control, which might make it accessible to untrusted parties.

cwe.name: Storage of File With Sensitive Data Under FTP Root
cwe.description: The product stores sensitive data under the FTP server root with insufficient access control, which might make it accessible to untrusted parties.

cwe.name: Information Loss or Omission
cwe.description: The product does not record, or improperly records, security-relevant information that leads to an incorrect decision or hampers later analysis.

cwe.name: Truncation of Security-relevant Information
cwe.description: The product truncates the display, recording, or processing of security-relevant information in a way that can obscure the source or nature of an attack.

cwe.name: Omission of Security-relevant Information
cwe.description: The product does not record or display information that would be important for identifying the source or nature of an attack, or determining if an action is safe.

cwe.name: Obscured Security-relevant Information by Alternate Name
cwe.description: The product records security-relevant information according to an alternate name of the affected entity, instead of the canonical name.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Obscured Security-relevant Information by Alternate Name

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: General Information Management Problems
cwe.description: This weakness can be found at CWE-199.

cwe.name: Sensitive Information in Resource Not Removed Before Reuse
cwe.description: The product releases a resource such as memory or a file so that it can be made available for reuse, but it does not clear or "zeroize" the information contained in the resource before the product performs a critical state transition or makes the resource available for reuse by other entities.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Clear sensitive information stored in reusable resources returned for reuse

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Syntactically Invalid Structure
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles input that is not syntactically well-formed with respect to the associated specification.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Values
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when the expected number of values for parameters, fields, or arguments is not provided in input, or if those values are undefined.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Missing Values
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a parameter, field, or argument name is specified, but the associated value is missing, i.e. it is empty, blank, or null.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not catch NullPointerException or any of its ancestors
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Extra Values
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when more values are provided than expected.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Undefined Values
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a value is not defined or supported for the associated parameter, field, or argument name.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not catch NullPointerException or any of its ancestors
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Parameters
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when the expected number of parameters, fields, or arguments is not provided in input, or if those parameters are undefined.

cwe.name: Failure to Handle Missing Parameter
cwe.description: If too few arguments are sent to a function, the function will still pop the expected number of arguments from the stack. Potentially, a variable number of arguments could be exhausted in a function as well.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Extra Parameters
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when the number of parameters, fields, or arguments with the same name exceeds the expected amount.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Undefined Parameters
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a particular parameter, field, or argument name is not defined or supported by the product.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Structural Elements
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles inputs that are related to complex structures.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Incomplete Structural Elements
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a particular structural element is not completely specified.

cwe.name: Failure to Handle Incomplete Element
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle when a particular element is not completely specified.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Inconsistent Structural Elements
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when two or more structural elements should be consistent, but are not.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a particular element is not the expected type, e.g. it expects a digit (0-9) but is provided with a letter (A-Z).

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not assume that fgets() or fgetws() returns a nonempty string when successful

cwe.name: Use of Inherently Dangerous Function
cwe.description: The product calls a function that can never be guaranteed to work safely.

cwe.name: Creation of chroot Jail Without Changing Working Directory
cwe.description: The product uses the chroot() system call to create a jail, but does not change the working directory afterward. This does not prevent access to files outside of the jail.

cwe.name: Improper Clearing of Heap Memory Before Release ('Heap Inspection')
cwe.description: Using realloc() to resize buffers that store sensitive information can leave the sensitive information exposed to attack, because it is not removed from memory.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Clear sensitive information stored in reusable resources returned for reuse

cwe.name: J2EE Bad Practices: Direct Management of Connections
cwe.description: The J2EE application directly manages connections, instead of using the container's connection management facilities.

cwe.name: J2EE Bad Practices: Direct Use of Sockets
cwe.description: The J2EE application directly uses sockets instead of using framework method calls.

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Reliance on DNS Lookups in a Security Decision
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated because it was a duplicate of CWE-350. All content has been transferred to CWE-350.

cwe.name: Uncaught Exception
cwe.description: An exception is thrown from a function, but it is not caught.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not let checked exceptions escape from a finally block
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not throw undeclared checked exceptions
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not suppress or ignore exceptions

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Often Misused: Path Manipulation
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated because of name confusion and an accidental combination of multiple weaknesses. Most of its content has been transferred to CWE-785.

cwe.name: Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
cwe.description: The product performs an operation at a privilege level that is higher than the minimum level required, which creates new weaknesses or amplifies the consequences of other weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Minimize privileges before deserializing from a privilege context
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Unchecked Return Value
cwe.description: The product does not check the return value from a method or function, which can prevent it from detecting unexpected states and conditions.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Detect and handle standard library errors
Detect and handle POSIX library errors
Do not ignore values returned by methods
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not ignore function return values

cwe.name: Incorrect Check of Function Return Value
cwe.description: The product incorrectly checks a return value from a function, which prevents it from detecting errors or exceptional conditions.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Detect and handle standard library errors
Detect and handle POSIX library errors

cwe.name: Plaintext Storage of a Password
cwe.description: Storing a password in plaintext may result in a system compromise.

cwe.name: Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format
cwe.description: The storage of passwords in a recoverable format makes them subject to password reuse attacks by malicious users. In fact, it should be noted that recoverable encrypted passwords provide no significant benefit over plaintext passwords since they are subject not only to reuse by malicious attackers but also by malicious insiders. If a system administrator can recover a password directly, or use a brute force search on the available information, the administrator can use the password on other accounts.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Storing passwords in a recoverable format

cwe.name: Empty Password in Configuration File
cwe.description: Using an empty string as a password is insecure.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Password Management: Empty Password in Configuration File

cwe.name: Use of Hard-coded Password
cwe.description: The product contains a hard-coded password, which it uses for its own inbound authentication or for outbound communication to external components.

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Password in Configuration File
cwe.description: The product stores a password in a configuration file that might be accessible to actors who do not know the password.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Password Management: Password in Configuration File

cwe.name: Weak Encoding for Password
cwe.description: Obscuring a password with a trivial encoding does not protect the password.

cwe.name: Not Using Password Aging
cwe.description: The product does not have a mechanism in place for managing password aging.

cwe.name: Password Aging with Long Expiration
cwe.description: The product supports password aging, but the expiration period is too long.

cwe.name: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
cwe.description: A product incorrectly assigns a privilege to a particular actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not allow privileged blocks to leak sensitive information across a trust boundary
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not allow tainted variables in privileged blocks
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Privilege Defined With Unsafe Actions
cwe.description: A particular privilege, role, capability, or right can be used to perform unsafe actions that were not intended, even when it is assigned to the correct entity.

cwe.name: Privilege Chaining
cwe.description: Two distinct privileges, roles, capabilities, or rights can be combined in a way that allows an entity to perform unsafe actions that would not be allowed without that combination.

cwe.name: Improper Privilege Management
cwe.description: The product does not properly assign, modify, track, or check privileges for an actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

cwe.name: Privilege Context Switching Error
cwe.description: The product does not properly manage privileges while it is switching between different contexts that have different privileges or spheres of control.

cwe.name: Privilege Dropping / Lowering Errors
cwe.description: The product does not drop privileges before passing control of a resource to an actor that does not have those privileges.

cwe.name: Least Privilege Violation
cwe.description: The elevated privilege level required to perform operations such as chroot() should be dropped immediately after the operation is performed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Failure to drop privileges when reasonable
Follow the principle of least privilege
Do not allow privileged blocks to leak sensitive information across a trust boundary
