cwe.description: The product stores sensitive data in memory that is not locked, or that has been incorrectly locked, which might cause the memory to be written to swap files on disk by the virtual memory manager. This can make the data more accessible to external actors.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that sensitive data is not written out to disk

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Authentication Bypass Issues
cwe.description: This weakness has been deprecated because it covered redundant concepts already described in CWE-287.

cwe.name: Authentication Bypass: OpenSSL CTX Object Modified after SSL Objects are Created
cwe.description: The product modifies the SSL context after connection creation has begun.

cwe.name: J2EE Framework: Saving Unserializable Objects to Disk
cwe.description: When the J2EE container attempts to write unserializable objects to disk there is no guarantee that the process will complete successfully.

cwe.name: Comparison of Object References Instead of Object Contents
cwe.description: The product compares object references instead of the contents of the objects themselves, preventing it from detecting equivalent objects.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use the two-argument Arrays.equals() method to compare the contents of arrays
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use the two-argument Arrays.equals() method to compare the contents of arrays
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use the equality operators when comparing values of boxed primitives
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Incorrect Semantic Object Comparison
cwe.description: This weakness has been deprecated. It was poorly described and difficult to distinguish from other entries. It was also inappropriate to assign a separate ID solely because of domain-specific considerations. Its closest equivalent is CWE-1023.

cwe.name: Use of Wrong Operator in String Comparison
cwe.description: The product uses the wrong operator when comparing a string, such as using "==" when the .equals() method should be used instead.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use the equality operators when comparing values of boxed primitives
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use the equality operators when comparing values of boxed primitives
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use the correct operator type for comparing values

cwe.name: Use of GET Request Method With Sensitive Query Strings
cwe.description: The web application uses the HTTP GET method to process a request and includes sensitive information in the query string of that request.

cwe.name: Missing Validation of OpenSSL Certificate
cwe.description: The product uses OpenSSL and trusts or uses a certificate without using the SSL_get_verify_result() function to ensure that the certificate satisfies all necessary security requirements.

cwe.name: Uncaught Exception in Servlet
cwe.description: The Servlet does not catch all exceptions, which may reveal sensitive debugging information.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not allow exceptions to expose sensitive information
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
cwe.description: The web application accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, and uses that link in a redirect.

cwe.name: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
cwe.description: The product is composed of a server that relies on the client to implement a mechanism that is intended to protect the server.

cwe.name: Use of Client-Side Authentication
cwe.description: A client/server product performs authentication within client code but not in server code, allowing server-side authentication to be bypassed via a modified client that omits the authentication check.

cwe.name: Multiple Binds to the Same Port
cwe.description: When multiple sockets are allowed to bind to the same port, other services on that port may be stolen or spoofed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Multiple binds to the same port

cwe.name: Unchecked Input for Loop Condition
cwe.description: The product does not properly check inputs that are used for loop conditions, potentially leading to a denial of service or other consequences because of excessive looping.

cwe.name: Public Static Final Field References Mutable Object
cwe.description: A public or protected static final field references a mutable object, which allows the object to be changed by malicious code, or accidentally from another package.

cwe.name: Struts: Non-private Field in ActionForm Class
cwe.description: An ActionForm class contains a field that has not been declared private, which can be accessed without using a setter or getter.

cwe.name: Double-Checked Locking
cwe.description: The product uses double-checked locking to access a resource without the overhead of explicit synchronization, but the locking is insufficient.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use incorrect forms of the double-checked locking idiom
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
cwe.description: The product uses an externally controlled name or reference that resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference
cwe.description: The product processes an XML document that can contain XML entities with URIs that resolve to documents outside of the intended sphere of control, causing the product to embed incorrect documents into its output.

cwe.name: Improper Authorization of Index Containing Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The product creates a search index of private or sensitive documents, but it does not properly limit index access to actors who are authorized to see the original information.

cwe.name: Insufficient Session Expiration
cwe.description: According to WASC, "Insufficient Session Expiration is when a web site permits an attacker to reuse old session credentials or session IDs for authorization."

cwe.name: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute
cwe.description: The Secure attribute for sensitive cookies in HTTPS sessions is not set, which could cause the user agent to send those cookies in plaintext over an HTTP session.

cwe.name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in Source Code Comments
cwe.description: While adding general comments is very useful, some programmers tend to leave important data, such as: filenames related to the web application, old links or links which were not meant to be browsed by users, old code fragments, etc.

cwe.name: Incomplete Identification of Uploaded File Variables (PHP)
cwe.description: The PHP application uses an old method for processing uploaded files by referencing the four global variables that are set for each file (e.g. $varname, $varname_size, $varname_name, $varname_type). These variables could be overwritten by attackers, causing the application to process unauthorized files.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Incomplete Identification of Uploaded File Variables (PHP)

cwe.name: Reachable Assertion
cwe.description: The product contains an assert() or similar statement that can be triggered by an attacker, which leads to an application exit or other behavior that is more severe than necessary.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Never use assertions to validate method arguments
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Exposed Unsafe ActiveX Method
cwe.description: An ActiveX control is intended for use in a web browser, but it exposes dangerous methods that perform actions that are outside of the browser's security model (e.g. the zone or domain).

cwe.name: Dangling Database Cursor ('Cursor Injection')
cwe.description: If a database cursor is not closed properly, then it could become accessible to other users while retaining the same privileges that were originally assigned, leaving the cursor "dangling."

cwe.name: Unverified Password Change
cwe.description: When setting a new password for a user, the product does not require knowledge of the original password, or using another form of authentication.

cwe.name: Variable Extraction Error
cwe.description: The product uses external input to determine the names of variables into which information is extracted, without verifying that the names of the specified variables are valid. This could cause the program to overwrite unintended variables.

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Function Hook Arguments
cwe.description: The product adds hooks to user-accessible API functions, but it does not properly validate the arguments. This could lead to resultant vulnerabilities.

cwe.name: Unsafe ActiveX Control Marked Safe For Scripting
cwe.description: An ActiveX control is intended for restricted use, but it has been marked as safe-for-scripting.

cwe.name: Executable Regular Expression Error
cwe.description: The product uses a regular expression that either (1) contains an executable component with user-controlled inputs, or (2) allows a user to enable execution by inserting pattern modifiers.

cwe.name: Permissive Regular Expression
cwe.description: The product uses a regular expression that does not sufficiently restrict the set of allowed values.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Sanitize untrusted data passed to a regex
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Null Byte Interaction Error (Poison Null Byte)
cwe.description: The product does not properly handle null bytes or NUL characters when passing data between different representations or components.

cwe.name: Dynamic Variable Evaluation
cwe.description: In a language where the user can influence the name of a variable at runtime, if the variable names are not controlled, an attacker can read or write to arbitrary variables, or access arbitrary functions.

cwe.name: Function Call with Incorrectly Specified Arguments
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine with arguments that are not correctly specified, leading to always-incorrect behavior and resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Maintain the contract between the writer and caller of variadic functions
Call functions with the correct number and type of arguments
Do not invoke a function in a context for which it is not defined

cwe.name: Not Failing Securely ('Failing Open')
cwe.description: When the product encounters an error condition or failure, its design requires it to fall back to a state that is less secure than other options that are available, such as selecting the weakest encryption algorithm or using the most permissive access control restrictions.

cwe.name: Unnecessary Complexity in Protection Mechanism (Not Using 'Economy of Mechanism')
cwe.description: The product uses a more complex mechanism than necessary, which could lead to resultant weaknesses when the mechanism is not correctly understood, modeled, configured, implemented, or used.

cwe.name: Not Using Complete Mediation
cwe.description: The product does not perform access checks on a resource every time the resource is accessed by an entity, which can create resultant weaknesses if that entity's rights or privileges change over time.

cwe.name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwe.description: The system's authorization functionality does not prevent one user from gaining access to another user's data or record by modifying the key value identifying the data.

cwe.name: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
cwe.description: The product contains a mechanism for users to recover or change their passwords without knowing the original password, but the mechanism is weak.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Names for Files and Other Resources
cwe.description: The product constructs the name of a file or other resource using input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the resulting name.

cwe.name: External Control of Critical State Data
cwe.description: The product stores security-critical state information about its users, or the product itself, in a location that is accessible to unauthorized actors.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Data within XPath Expressions ('XPath Injection')
cwe.description: The product uses external input to dynamically construct an XPath expression used to retrieve data from an XML database, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes that input. This allows an attacker to control the structure of the query.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax
cwe.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes web scripting syntax in HTTP headers that can be used by web browser components that can process raw headers, such as Flash.

cwe.name: Overly Restrictive Account Lockout Mechanism
cwe.description: The product contains an account lockout protection mechanism, but the mechanism is too restrictive and can be triggered too easily, which allows attackers to deny service to legitimate users by causing their accounts to be locked out.

cwe.name: Reliance on File Name or Extension of Externally-Supplied File
cwe.description: The product allows a file to be uploaded, but it relies on the file name or extension of the file to determine the appropriate behaviors. This could be used by attackers to cause the file to be misclassified and processed in a dangerous fashion.

cwe.name: Use of Non-Canonical URL Paths for Authorization Decisions
cwe.description: The product defines policy namespaces and makes authorization decisions based on the assumption that a URL is canonical. This can allow a non-canonical URL to bypass the authorization.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Canonicalize path names before validating them
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Incorrect Use of Privileged APIs
cwe.description: The product does not conform to the API requirements for a function call that requires extra privileges. This could allow attackers to gain privileges by causing the function to be called incorrectly.

cwe.name: Reliance on Obfuscation or Encryption of Security-Relevant Inputs without Integrity Checking
cwe.description: The product uses obfuscation or encryption of inputs that should not be mutable by an external actor, but the product does not use integrity checks to detect if those inputs have been modified.

cwe.name: Trusting HTTP Permission Methods on the Server Side
cwe.description: The server contains a protection mechanism that assumes that any URI that is accessed using HTTP GET will not cause a state change to the associated resource. This might allow attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and conduct resource modification and deletion attacks, since some applications allow GET to modify state.

cwe.name: Exposure of WSDL File Containing Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The Web services architecture may require exposing a Web Service Definition Language (WSDL) file that contains information on the publicly accessible services and how callers of these services should interact with them (e.g. what parameters they expect and what types they return).

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Data within XQuery Expressions ('XQuery Injection')
cwe.description: The product uses external input to dynamically construct an XQuery expression used to retrieve data from an XML database, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes that input. This allows an attacker to control the structure of the query.

cwe.name: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization
cwe.description: The product does not properly compartmentalize or isolate functionality, processes, or resources that require different privilege levels, rights, or permissions.

cwe.name: Reliance on a Single Factor in a Security Decision
cwe.description: A protection mechanism relies exclusively, or to a large extent, on the evaluation of a single condition or the integrity of a single object or entity in order to make a decision about granting access to restricted resources or functionality.

cwe.name: Insufficient Psychological Acceptability
cwe.description: The product has a protection mechanism that is too difficult or inconvenient to use, encouraging non-malicious users to disable or bypass the mechanism, whether by accident or on purpose.

cwe.name: Reliance on Security Through Obscurity
cwe.description: The product uses a protection mechanism whose strength depends heavily on its obscurity, such that knowledge of its algorithms or key data is sufficient to defeat the mechanism.

cwe.name: Violation of Secure Design Principles
cwe.description: The product violates well-established principles for secure design.

cwe.name: Improper Synchronization
cwe.description: The product utilizes multiple threads or processes to allow temporary access to a shared resource that can only be exclusive to one process at a time, but it does not properly synchronize these actions, which might cause simultaneous accesses of this resource by multiple threads or processes.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Mask signals handled by noninterruptible signal handlers
Do not access shared objects in signal handlers
Do not assume that a group of calls to independently atomic methods is atomic
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context
cwe.description: The product calls a non-reentrant function in a concurrent context in which a competing code sequence (e.g. thread or signal handler) may have an opportunity to call the same function or otherwise influence its state.

cwe.name: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime
cwe.description: The product does not maintain or incorrectly maintains control over a resource throughout its lifetime of creation, use, and release.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not alternately input and output from a stream without an intervening flush or positioning call

cwe.name: Improper Initialization
cwe.description: The product does not initialize or incorrectly initializes a resource, which might leave the resource in an unexpected state when it is accessed or used.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Explicitly specify array bounds, even if implicitly defined by an initializer

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Operation on Resource in Wrong Phase of Lifetime
cwe.description: The product performs an operation on a resource at the wrong phase of the resource's lifecycle, which can lead to unexpected behaviors.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not access a closed file

cwe.name: Improper Locking
cwe.description: The product does not properly acquire or release a lock on a resource, leading to unexpected resource state changes and behaviors.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not destroy a mutex while it is locked
Do not unlock or destroy another POSIX thread's mutex
Ensure visibility when accessing shared primitive variables
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that compound operations on shared variables are atomic
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure atomicity when reading and writing 64-bit values
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not use an instance lock to protect shared static data
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
cwe.description: The product exposes a resource to the wrong control sphere, providing unintended actors with inappropriate access to the resource.

cwe.name: Incorrect Resource Transfer Between Spheres
cwe.description: The product does not properly transfer a resource/behavior to another sphere, or improperly imports a resource/behavior from another sphere, in a manner that provides unintended control over that resource.

cwe.name: Always-Incorrect Control Flow Implementation
cwe.description: The code contains a control flow path that does not reflect the algorithm that the path is intended to implement, leading to incorrect behavior any time this path is navigated.

cwe.name: Lack of Administrator Control over Security
cwe.description: The product uses security features in a way that prevents the product's administrator from tailoring security settings to reflect the environment in which the product is being used. This introduces resultant weaknesses or prevents it from operating at a level of security that is desired by the administrator.

cwe.name: Operation on a Resource after Expiration or Release
cwe.description: The product uses, accesses, or otherwise operates on a resource after that resource has been expired, released, or revoked.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not access a closed file

cwe.name: External Influence of Sphere Definition
cwe.description: The product does not prevent the definition of control spheres from external actors.

cwe.name: Uncontrolled Recursion
cwe.description: The product does not properly control the amount of recursion that takes place, consuming excessive resources, such as allocated memory or the program stack.

cwe.name: Multiple Operations on Resource in Single-Operation Context
cwe.description: The product performs the same operation on a resource two or more times, when the operation should only be applied once.

cwe.name: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
cwe.description: The product invokes a potentially dangerous function that could introduce a vulnerability if it is used incorrectly, but the function can also be used safely.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Avoid race conditions when using library functions
Prefer functions that support error checking over equivalent functions that don't
Detect errors when converting a string to a number
Be careful using functions that use file names for identification
Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers
Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

cwe.name: Integer Overflow to Buffer Overflow
cwe.description: The product performs a calculation to determine how much memory to allocate, but an integer overflow can occur that causes less memory to be allocated than expected, leading to a buffer overflow.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap
Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow
Allocate sufficient memory for an object

cwe.name: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types
cwe.description: When converting from one data type to another, such as long to integer, data can be omitted or translated in a way that produces unexpected values. If the resulting values are used in a sensitive context, then dangerous behaviors may occur.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure that floating point conversions are within range of the new type
Use intmax_t or uintmax_t for formatted IO on programmer-defined integer types
Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
Evaluate integer expressions in a larger size before comparing or assigning to that size
Ensure conversions of numeric types to narrower types do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Incorrect Calculation
cwe.description: The product performs a calculation that generates incorrect or unintended results that are later used in security-critical decisions or resource management.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Prevent or detect domain and range errors in math functions
Use only explicitly signed or unsigned char type for numeric values
Use bitwise operators only on unsigned operands
Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors
Do not shift an expression by a negative number of bits or by greater than or equal  to the number of bits that exist in the operand

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrect Order of Arguments
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies the arguments in an incorrect order, leading to resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Incorrect Provision of Specified Functionality
cwe.description: The code does not function according to its published specifications, potentially leading to incorrect usage.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not replace secure functions with less secure functions

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrect Number of Arguments
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies too many arguments, or too few arguments, which may lead to undefined behavior and resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Call functions with the correct number and type of arguments

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrect Argument Type
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies an argument that is the wrong data type, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Call functions with the correct number and type of arguments
Do not call putenv() with a pointer to an automatic variable as the argument
Arguments to character handling functions must be representable as an unsigned char

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrectly Specified Argument Value
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies an argument that contains the wrong value, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not perform zero length allocations

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrect Variable or Reference as Argument
cwe.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies the wrong variable or reference as one of the arguments, which may lead to undefined behavior and resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Permission Race Condition During Resource Copy
cwe.description: The product, while copying or cloning a resource, does not set the resource's permissions or access control until the copy is complete, leaving the resource exposed to other spheres while the copy is taking place.

cwe.name: Unchecked Return Value to NULL Pointer Dereference
cwe.description: The product does not check for an error after calling a function that can return with a NULL pointer if the function fails, which leads to a resultant NULL pointer dereference.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not catch NullPointerException or any of its ancestors
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not ignore function return values

cwe.name: Insufficient Control Flow Management
cwe.description: The code does not sufficiently manage its control flow during execution, creating conditions in which the control flow can be modified in unexpected ways.

cwe.name: Incomplete Denylist to Cross-Site Scripting
cwe.description: The product uses a denylist-based protection mechanism to defend against XSS attacks, but the denylist is incomplete, allowing XSS variants to succeed.

cwe.name: Protection Mechanism Failure
cwe.description: The product does not use or incorrectly uses a protection mechanism that provides sufficient defense against directed attacks against the product.

cwe.name: Use of Multiple Resources with Duplicate Identifier
cwe.description: The product uses multiple resources that can have the same identifier, in a context in which unique identifiers are required.

cwe.name: Use of Low-Level Functionality
cwe.description: The product uses low-level functionality that is explicitly prohibited by the framework or specification under which the product is supposed to operate.

cwe.name: Incorrect Behavior Order
cwe.description: The product performs multiple related behaviors, but the behaviors are performed in the wrong order in ways which may produce resultant weaknesses.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Observe correct revocation order while relinquishing privileges

cwe.name: Incorrect Comparison
cwe.description: The product compares two entities in a security-relevant context, but the comparison is incorrect, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Execution After Redirect (EAR)
cwe.description: The web application sends a redirect to another location, but instead of exiting, it executes additional code.

cwe.name: Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions
cwe.description: The product does not properly anticipate or handle exceptional conditions that rarely occur during normal operation of the product.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not throw undeclared checked exceptions
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
cwe.description: The product does not correctly convert an object, resource, or structure from one type to a different type.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not cast away a const qualification
Do not access a variable through a pointer of an incompatible type
Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
Converting a pointer to integer or integer to pointer
Cast characters to unsigned types before converting to larger integer sizes
Arguments to character handling functions must be representable as an unsigned char

cwe.name: Incorrect Control Flow Scoping
cwe.description: The product does not properly return control flow to the proper location after it has completed a task or detected an unusual condition.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: All exit handlers must return normally
Do not use Thread.stop() to terminate threads
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not complete abruptly from a finally block
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not let checked exceptions escape from a finally block
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not suppress or ignore exceptions

cwe.name: Use of Incorrectly-Resolved Name or Reference
cwe.description: The product uses a name or reference to access a resource, but the name/reference resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization
cwe.description: The product does not ensure or incorrectly ensures that structured messages or data are well-formed and that certain security properties are met before being read from an upstream component or sent to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Incorrect Ownership Assignment
cwe.description: The product assigns an owner to a resource, but the owner is outside of the intended control sphere.

cwe.name: Improper Adherence to Coding Standards
cwe.description: The product does not follow certain coding rules for development, which can lead to resultant weaknesses or increase the severity of the associated vulnerabilities.

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwe.description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Create files with appropriate access permission
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not allow tainted variables in privileged blocks
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not grant dangerous combinations of permissions
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Create files with appropriate access permissions

cwe.name: Compiler Optimization Removal or Modification of Security-critical Code
cwe.description: The developer builds a security-critical protection mechanism into the software, but the compiler optimizes the program such that the mechanism is removed or modified.

cwe.name: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
cwe.description: The product provides an Applications Programming Interface (API) or similar interface for interaction with external actors, but the interface includes a dangerous method or function that is not properly restricted.

cwe.name: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions
cwe.description: The product does not check or incorrectly checks for unusual or exceptional conditions that are not expected to occur frequently during day to day operation of the product.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not suppress or ignore exceptions

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
cwe.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles an exceptional condition.

cwe.name: Missing Custom Error Page
cwe.description: The product does not return custom error pages to the user, possibly exposing sensitive information.

cwe.name: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation ('Algorithm Downgrade')
cwe.description: A protocol or its implementation supports interaction between multiple actors and allows those actors to negotiate which algorithm should be used as a protection mechanism such as encryption or authentication, but it does not select the strongest algorithm that is available to both parties.

cwe.name: Reliance on Undefined, Unspecified, or Implementation-Defined Behavior
cwe.description: The product uses an API function, data structure, or other entity in a way that relies on properties that are not always guaranteed to hold for that entity.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure size arguments for variable length arrays are in a valid range
Detect errors when converting a string to a number
Do not depend on the order of evaluation for side effects
Do not access a closed file
Do not shift an expression by a negative number of bits or by greater than or equal  to the number of bits that exist in the operand
Converting a pointer to integer or integer to pointer
Do not introduce unnecessary platform dependencies
Do not depend on undefined behavior
Ensure that control never reaches the end of a non-void function

cwe.name: Use of a One-Way Hash without a Salt
cwe.description: The product uses a one-way cryptographic hash against an input that should not be reversible, such as a password, but the product does not also use a salt as part of the input.

cwe.name: Use of a One-Way Hash with a Predictable Salt
cwe.description: The product uses a one-way cryptographic hash against an input that should not be reversible, such as a password, but the product uses a predictable salt as part of the input.

cwe.name: Free of Pointer not at Start of Buffer
cwe.description: The product calls free() on a pointer to a memory resource that was allocated on the heap, but the pointer is not at the start of the buffer.

cwe.name: Mismatched Memory Management Routines
cwe.description: The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls a release function that is not compatible with the function that was originally used to allocate that resource.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Properly pair allocation and deallocation functions

cwe.name: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference
cwe.description: The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls the wrong release function or calls the appropriate release function incorrectly.

cwe.name: Multiple Locks of a Critical Resource
cwe.description: The product locks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

cwe.name: Multiple Unlocks of a Critical Resource
cwe.description: The product unlocks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

cwe.name: Critical Data Element Declared Public
cwe.description: The product declares a critical variable, field, or member to be public when intended security policy requires it to be private.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Failure to protect stored data from modification
Declare data members as private and provide accessible wrapper methods
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method
cwe.description: The product defines a public method that reads or modifies a private variable.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Failure to protect stored data from modification
Do not access private variables or subroutines in other packages

cwe.name: Incorrect Short Circuit Evaluation
cwe.description: The product contains a conditional statement with multiple logical expressions in which one of the non-leading expressions may produce side effects. This may lead to an unexpected state in the program after the execution of the conditional, because short-circuiting logic may prevent the side effects from occurring.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Failure to protect stored data from modification

cwe.name: DEPRECATED: Uncontrolled File Descriptor Consumption
cwe.description: This entry has been deprecated because it was a duplicate of CWE-774. All content has been transferred to CWE-774.

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwe.description: The product allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of an actor without imposing any restrictions on the size or number of resources that can be allocated, in violation of the intended security policy for that actor.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Close resources when they are no longer needed
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Avoid memory and resource leaks during serialization
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)
The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Missing Reference to Active Allocated Resource
cwe.description: The product does not properly maintain a reference to a resource that has been allocated, which prevents the resource from being reclaimed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Close files when they are no longer needed
Free dynamically allocated memory when no longer needed

cwe.name: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
cwe.description: The product does not release a resource after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the resource is no longer needed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Close files when they are no longer needed
Free dynamically allocated memory when no longer needed

cwe.name: Missing Reference to Active File Descriptor or Handle
cwe.description: The product does not properly maintain references to a file descriptor or handle, which prevents that file descriptor/handle from being reclaimed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Close files when they are no longer needed

cwe.name: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling
cwe.description: The product allocates file descriptors or handles on behalf of an actor without imposing any restrictions on how many descriptors can be allocated, in violation of the intended security policy for that actor.

cwe.name: Missing Release of File Descriptor or Handle after Effective Lifetime
cwe.description: The product does not release a file descriptor or handle after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the file descriptor/handle is no longer needed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Close files when they are no longer needed

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')
cwe.description: The product uses XML documents and allows their structure to be defined with a Document Type Definition (DTD), but it does not properly control the number of recursive definitions of entities.

cwe.name: Regular Expression without Anchors
cwe.description: The product uses a regular expression to perform neutralization, but the regular expression is not anchored and may allow malicious or malformed data to slip through.

cwe.name: Insufficient Logging
cwe.description: When a security-critical event occurs, the product either does not record the event or omits important details about the event when logging it.

cwe.name: Logging of Excessive Data
cwe.description: The product logs too much information, making log files hard to process and possibly hindering recovery efforts or forensic analysis after an attack.

cwe.name: Use of RSA Algorithm without OAEP
cwe.description: The product uses the RSA algorithm but does not incorporate Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP), which might weaken the encryption.

cwe.name: Improper Address Validation in IOCTL with METHOD_NEITHER I/O Control Code
cwe.description: The product defines an IOCTL that uses METHOD_NEITHER for I/O, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates the addresses that are provided.

cwe.name: Exposed IOCTL with Insufficient Access Control
cwe.description: The product implements an IOCTL with functionality that should be restricted, but it does not properly enforce access control for the IOCTL.

cwe.name: Operator Precedence Logic Error
cwe.description: The product uses an expression in which operator precedence causes incorrect logic to be used.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use parentheses for precedence of operation
Do not mix the early-precedence logical operators with late-precedence logical operators

cwe.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking in a Security Decision
cwe.description: The product uses a protection mechanism that relies on the existence or values of a cookie, but it does not properly ensure that the cookie is valid for the associated user.

cwe.name: Use of Path Manipulation Function without Maximum-sized Buffer
cwe.description: The product invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

cwe.name: Access of Memory Location Before Start of Buffer
cwe.description: The product reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location prior to the beginning of the buffer.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts

cwe.name: Out-of-bounds Write
cwe.description: The product writes data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

cwe.name: Access of Memory Location After End of Buffer
cwe.description: The product reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end of the buffer.

cwe.name: Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value
cwe.description: The product allocates memory based on an untrusted, large size value, but it does not ensure that the size is within expected limits, allowing arbitrary amounts of memory to be allocated.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Allocate sufficient memory for an object
Validate any integer that is used as an array index

cwe.name: Improper Filtering of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not filter or incorrectly filters special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Incomplete Filtering of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not completely filter special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Incomplete Filtering of One or More Instances of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not completely filter one or more instances of special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Only Filtering One Instance of a Special Element
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only filters a single instance of a special element before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Incomplete Filtering of Multiple Instances of Special Elements
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not filter all instances of a special element before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Only Filtering Special Elements at a Specified Location
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements at a specified location, thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Only Filtering Special Elements Relative to a Marker
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements positioned relative to a marker (e.g. "at the beginning/end of a string; the second argument"), thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Only Filtering Special Elements at an Absolute Position
cwe.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements at an absolute position (e.g. "byte number 10"), thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

cwe.name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
cwe.description: The product contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key.

taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency
cwe.description: The product does not properly limit the number or frequency of interactions that it has with an actor, such as the number of incoming requests.

cwe.name: Guessable CAPTCHA
cwe.description: The product uses a CAPTCHA challenge, but the challenge can be guessed or automatically recognized by a non-human actor.

cwe.name: Buffer Access with Incorrect Length Value
cwe.description: The product uses a sequential operation to read or write a buffer, but it uses an incorrect length value that causes it to access memory that is outside of the bounds of the buffer.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers

cwe.name: Buffer Access Using Size of Source Buffer
cwe.description: The product uses the size of a source buffer when reading from or writing to a destination buffer, which may cause it to access memory that is outside of the bounds of the buffer.

cwe.name: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
cwe.description: The product uses a protection mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not base security checks on untrusted sources
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Missing Synchronization
cwe.description: The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner but does not attempt to synchronize access to the resource.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Synchronize access to static fields that can be modified by untrusted code
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Incorrect Synchronization
cwe.description: The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner, but it does not correctly synchronize access to the resource.

cwe.name: Untrusted Pointer Dereference
cwe.description: The product obtains a value from an untrusted source, converts this value to a pointer, and dereferences the resulting pointer.

cwe.name: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset
cwe.description: The product performs pointer arithmetic on a valid pointer, but it uses an offset that can point outside of the intended range of valid memory locations for the resulting pointer.

cwe.name: Access of Uninitialized Pointer
cwe.description: The product accesses or uses a pointer that has not been initialized.

cwe.name: Expired Pointer Dereference
cwe.description: The product dereferences a pointer that contains a location for memory that was previously valid, but is no longer valid.

cwe.name: Premature Release of Resource During Expected Lifetime
cwe.description: The product releases a resource that is still intended to be used by itself or another actor.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Document Type Definition
cwe.description: The product does not restrict a reference to a Document Type Definition (DTD) to the intended control sphere. This might allow attackers to reference arbitrary DTDs, possibly causing the product to expose files, consume excessive system resources, or execute arbitrary http requests on behalf of the attacker.

cwe.name: Signal Handler with Functionality that is not Asynchronous-Safe
cwe.description: The product defines a signal handler that contains code sequences that are not asynchronous-safe, i.e., the functionality is not reentrant, or it can be interrupted.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not access or modify shared objects in signal handlers

cwe.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwe.description: The product imports, requires, or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

cwe.name: Inclusion of Web Functionality from an Untrusted Source
cwe.description: The product includes web functionality (such as a web widget) from another domain, which causes it to operate within the domain of the product, potentially granting total access and control of the product to the untrusted source.

cwe.name: Signal Handler Function Associated with Multiple Signals
cwe.description: The product defines a function that is used as a handler for more than one signal.

cwe.name: Unlock of a Resource that is not Locked
cwe.description: The product attempts to unlock a resource that is not locked.

cwe.name: Deadlock
cwe.description: The product contains multiple threads or executable segments that are waiting for each other to release a necessary lock, resulting in deadlock.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Ensure actively held locks are released on exceptional conditions
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Excessive Iteration
cwe.description: The product performs an iteration or loop without sufficiently limiting the number of times that the loop is executed.

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
cwe.description: The product contains an iteration or loop with an exit condition that cannot be reached, i.e., an infinite loop.

cwe.name: Use of Password Hash Instead of Password for Authentication
cwe.description: The product records password hashes in a data store, receives a hash of a password from a client, and compares the supplied hash to the hash obtained from the data store.

cwe.name: Improper Enforcement of a Single, Unique Action
cwe.description: The product requires that an actor should only be able to perform an action once, or to have only one unique action, but the product does not enforce or improperly enforces this restriction.

cwe.name: Inappropriate Encoding for Output Context
cwe.description: The product uses or specifies an encoding when generating output to a downstream component, but the specified encoding is not the same as the encoding that is expected by the downstream component.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Use compatible encodings on both sides of file or network IO
taxonomyMappings.Taxonomy_Name: The CERT Oracle Secure Coding Standard for Java (2011)

cwe.name: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check
cwe.description: The product checks a value to ensure that it is less than or equal to a maximum, but it does not also verify that the value is greater than or equal to the minimum.

cwe.name: Improper Enforcement of Behavioral Workflow
cwe.description: The product supports a session in which more than one behavior must be performed by an actor, but it does not properly ensure that the actor performs the behaviors in the required sequence.

cwe.name: Placement of User into Incorrect Group
cwe.description: The product or the administrator places a user into an incorrect group.

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
cwe.description: The product allocates or initializes a resource such as a pointer, object, or variable using one type, but it later accesses that resource using a type that is incompatible with the original type.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not access a variable through a pointer of an incompatible type

cwe.name: Missing Authorization
cwe.description: The product does not perform an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

cwe.name: Incorrect Authorization
cwe.description: The product performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action, but it does not correctly perform the check.

cwe.name: Use of Uninitialized Resource
cwe.description: The product uses or accesses a resource that has not been initialized.

cwe.name: Missing Initialization of Resource
cwe.description: The product does not initialize a critical resource.

cwe.name: Use of Expired File Descriptor
cwe.description: The product uses or accesses a file descriptor after it has been closed.

taxonomyMappings.Entry_Name: Do not access a closed file

cwe.name: Improper Update of Reference Count
cwe.description: The product uses a reference count to manage a resource, but it does not update or incorrectly updates the reference count.

cwe.name: Hidden Functionality
cwe.description: The product contains functionality that is not documented, not part of the specification, and not accessible through an interface or command sequence that is obvious to the product's users or administrators.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Managed Code Resources
cwe.description: The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-managed code resources such as variables, objects, classes, attributes, functions, or executable instructions or statements.

cwe.name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Identified Variables
cwe.description: The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-identified variables.

cwe.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes
cwe.description: The product receives input from an upstream component that specifies multiple attributes, properties, or fields that are to be initialized or updated in an object, but it does not properly control which attributes can be modified.

cwe.name: Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort
cwe.description: The product generates a hash for a password, but it uses a scheme that does not provide a sufficient level of computational effort that would make password cracking attacks infeasible or expensive.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an Expression Language Statement ('Expression Language Injection')
cwe.description: The product constructs all or part of an expression language (EL) statement in a framework such as a Java Server Page (JSP) using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended EL statement before it is executed.

cwe.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
cwe.description: The web server receives a URL or similar request from an upstream component and retrieves the contents of this URL, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the request is being sent to the expected destination.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Power Consumption
cwe.description: The product operates in an environment in which power is a limited resource that cannot be automatically replenished, but the product does not properly restrict the amount of power that its operation consumes.

cwe.name: Storage of Sensitive Data in a Mechanism without Access Control
cwe.description: The product stores sensitive information in a file system or device that does not have built-in access control.

cwe.name: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information
cwe.description: The product stores sensitive information without properly limiting read or write access by unauthorized actors.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Communication Channel to Intended Endpoints
cwe.description: The product establishes a communication channel to (or from) an endpoint for privileged or protected operations, but it does not properly ensure that it is communicating with the correct endpoint.

cwe.name: Improper Enforcement of Message Integrity During Transmission in a Communication Channel
cwe.description: The product establishes a communication channel with an endpoint and receives a message from that endpoint, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the message was not modified during transmission.

cwe.name: Improper Verification of Intent by Broadcast Receiver
cwe.description: The Android application uses a Broadcast Receiver that receives an Intent but does not properly verify that the Intent came from an authorized source.

cwe.name: Improper Export of Android Application Components
cwe.description: The Android application exports a component for use by other applications, but does not properly restrict which applications can launch the component or access the data it contains.

cwe.name: Use of Implicit Intent for Sensitive Communication
cwe.description: The Android application uses an implicit intent for transmitting sensitive data to other applications.

cwe.name: Improper Authorization in Handler for Custom URL Scheme
cwe.description: The product uses a handler for a custom URL scheme, but it does not properly restrict which actors can invoke the handler using the scheme.

cwe.name: Improper Verification of Source of a Communication Channel
cwe.description: The product establishes a communication channel to handle an incoming request that has been initiated by an actor, but it does not properly verify that the request is coming from the expected origin.

cwe.name: Incorrectly Specified Destination in a Communication Channel
cwe.description: The product creates a communication channel to initiate an outgoing request to an actor, but it does not correctly specify the intended destination for that actor.

cwe.name: Permissive Cross-domain Policy with Untrusted Domains
cwe.description: The product uses a cross-domain policy file that includes domains that should not be trusted.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Data Query Logic
cwe.description: The product generates a query intended to access or manipulate data in a data store such as a database, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that can modify the intended logic of the query.

cwe.name: Sensitive Cookie Without 'HttpOnly' Flag
cwe.description: The product uses a cookie to store sensitive information, but the cookie is not marked with the HttpOnly flag.

cwe.name: Insufficient Visual Distinction of Homoglyphs Presented to User
cwe.description: The product displays information or identifiers to a user, but the display mechanism does not make it easy for the user to distinguish between visually similar or identical glyphs (homoglyphs), which may cause the user to misinterpret a glyph and perform an unintended, insecure action.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames
cwe.description: The web application does not restrict or incorrectly restricts frame objects or UI layers that belong to another application or domain, which can lead to user confusion about which interface the user is interacting with.

cwe.name: Use of Web Link to Untrusted Target with window.opener Access
cwe.description: The web application produces links to untrusted external sites outside of its sphere of control, but it does not properly prevent the external site from modifying security-critical properties of the window.opener object, such as the location property.

cwe.name: Incomplete Comparison with Missing Factors
cwe.description: The product performs a comparison between entities that must consider multiple factors or characteristics of each entity, but the comparison does not include one or more of these factors.

cwe.name: Comparison of Incompatible Types
cwe.description: The product performs a comparison between two entities, but the entities are of different, incompatible types that cannot be guaranteed to provide correct results when they are directly compared.

cwe.name: Comparison Using Wrong Factors
cwe.description: The code performs a comparison between two entities, but the comparison examines the wrong factors or characteristics of the entities, which can lead to incorrect results and resultant weaknesses.

cwe.name: Processor Optimization Removal or Modification of Security-critical Code
cwe.description: The developer builds a security-critical protection mechanism into the software, but the processor optimizes the execution of the program such that the mechanism is removed or modified.

cwe.name: Insecure Automated Optimizations
cwe.description: The product uses a mechanism that automatically optimizes code, e.g. to improve a characteristic such as performance, but the optimizations can have an unintended side effect that might violate an intended security assumption.

cwe.name: Inadequate Detection or Handling of Adversarial Input Perturbations in Automated Recognition Mechanism
cwe.description: The product uses an automated mechanism such as machine learning to recognize complex data inputs (e.g. image or audio) as a particular concept or category, but it does not properly detect or handle inputs that have been modified or constructed in a way that causes the mechanism to detect a different, incorrect concept.

cwe.name: Use of Redundant Code
cwe.description: The product has multiple functions, methods, procedures, macros, etc. that contain the same code.

cwe.name: Static Member Data Element outside of a Singleton Class Element
cwe.description: The code contains a member element that is declared as static (but not final), in which its parent class element is not a singleton class - that is, a class element that can be used only once in the 'to' association of a Create action.

cwe.name: Data Element Aggregating an Excessively Large Number of Non-Primitive Elements
cwe.description: The product uses a data element that has an excessively large number of sub-elements with non-primitive data types such as structures or aggregated objects.

cwe.name: Architecture with Number of Horizontal Layers Outside of Expected Range
cwe.description: The product's architecture contains too many - or too few - horizontal layers.

cwe.name: Parent Class with a Virtual Destructor and a Child Class without a Virtual Destructor
cwe.description: A parent class has a virtual destructor method, but the parent has a child class that does not have a virtual destructor.

cwe.name: Creation of Immutable Text Using String Concatenation
cwe.description: The product creates an immutable text string using string concatenation operations.

cwe.name: Modules with Circular Dependencies
cwe.description: The product contains modules in which one module has references that cycle back to itself, i.e., there are circular dependencies.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element with Large Number of Outward Calls
cwe.description: The code contains callable control elements that contain an excessively large number of references to other application objects external to the context of the callable, i.e. a Fan-Out value that is excessively large.

cwe.name: Excessive Data Query Operations in a Large Data Table
cwe.description: The product performs a data query with a large number of joins and sub-queries on a large data table.

cwe.name: Excessive Platform Resource Consumption within a Loop
cwe.description: The product has a loop body or loop condition that contains a control element that directly or indirectly consumes platform resources, e.g. messaging, sessions, locks, or file descriptors.

cwe.name: Initialization with Hard-Coded Network Resource Configuration Data
cwe.description: The product initializes data using hard-coded values that act as network resource identifiers.

cwe.name: Excessive Use of Hard-Coded Literals in Initialization
cwe.description: The product initializes a data element using a hard-coded literal that is not a simple integer or static constant element.

cwe.name: Missing Documentation for Design
cwe.description: The product does not have documentation that represents how it is designed.

cwe.name: Invocation of a Control Element at an Unnecessarily Deep Horizontal Layer
cwe.description: The code at one architectural layer invokes code that resides at a deeper layer than the adjacent layer, i.e., the invocation skips at least one layer, and the invoked code is not part of a vertical utility layer that can be referenced from any horizontal layer.

cwe.name: Multiple Inheritance from Concrete Classes
cwe.description: The product contains a class with inheritance from more than one concrete class.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element with Variadic Parameters
cwe.description: A named-callable or method control element has a signature that supports a variable (variadic) number of parameters or arguments.

cwe.name: Data Access Operations Outside of Expected Data Manager Component
cwe.description: The product uses a dedicated, central data manager component as required by design, but it contains code that performs data-access operations that do not use this data manager.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element in Multi-Thread Context with non-Final Static Storable or Member Element
cwe.description: The code contains a function or method that operates in a multi-threaded environment but owns an unsafe non-final static storable or member data element.

cwe.name: Insufficient Technical Documentation
cwe.description: The product does not contain sufficient technical or engineering documentation (whether on paper or in electronic form) that contains descriptions of all the relevant software/hardware elements of the product, such as its usage, structure, architectural components, interfaces, design, implementation, configuration, operation, etc.

cwe.name: Excessive Number of Inefficient Server-Side Data Accesses
cwe.description: The product performs too many data queries without using efficient data processing functionality such as stored procedures.

cwe.name: Insufficient Encapsulation
cwe.description: The product does not sufficiently hide the internal representation and implementation details of data or methods, which might allow external components or modules to modify data unexpectedly, invoke unexpected functionality, or introduce dependencies that the programmer did not intend.

cwe.name: Parent Class with References to Child Class
cwe.description: The code has a parent class that contains references to a child class, its methods, or its members.

cwe.name: Creation of Class Instance within a Static Code Block
cwe.description: A static code block creates an instance of a class.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element with Signature Containing an Excessive Number of Parameters
cwe.description: The product contains a function, subroutine, or method whose signature has an unnecessarily large number of parameters/arguments.

cwe.name: Runtime Resource Management Control Element in a Component Built to Run on Application Servers
cwe.description: The product uses deployed components from application servers, but it also uses low-level functions/methods for management of resources, instead of the API provided by the application server.

cwe.name: Missing Serialization Control Element
cwe.description: The product contains a serializable data element that does not have an associated serialization method.

cwe.name: Excessive Execution of Sequential Searches of Data Resource
cwe.description: The product contains a data query against an SQL table or view that is configured in a way that does not utilize an index and may cause sequential searches to be performed.

cwe.name: Inconsistency Between Implementation and Documented Design
cwe.description: The implementation of the product is not consistent with the design as described within the relevant documentation.

cwe.name: Empty Exception Block
cwe.description: An invokable code block contains an exception handling block that does not contain any code, i.e. is empty.

cwe.name: Serializable Data Element Containing non-Serializable Item Elements
cwe.description: The product contains a serializable, storable data element such as a field or member, but the data element contains member elements that are not serializable.

cwe.name: Empty Code Block
cwe.description: The source code contains a block that does not contain any code, i.e., the block is empty.

cwe.name: Data Resource Access without Use of Connection Pooling
cwe.description: The product accesses a data resource through a database without using a connection pooling capability.

cwe.name: Non-SQL Invokable Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Accesses
cwe.description: The product contains a client with a function or method that contains a large number of data accesses/queries that are sent through a data manager, i.e., does not use efficient database capabilities.

cwe.name: Class with Excessively Deep Inheritance
cwe.description: A class has an inheritance level that is too high, i.e., it has a large number of parent classes.

cwe.name: Unconditional Control Flow Transfer outside of Switch Block
cwe.description: The product performs unconditional control transfer (such as a "goto") in code outside of a branching structure such as a switch block.

cwe.name: Insufficient Adherence to Expected Conventions
cwe.description: The product's architecture, source code, design, documentation, or other artifact does not follow required conventions.

cwe.name: Floating Point Comparison with Incorrect Operator
cwe.description: The code performs a comparison such as an equality test between two float (floating point) values, but it uses comparison operators that do not account for the possibility of loss of precision.

cwe.name: Inappropriate Source Code Style or Formatting
cwe.description: The source code does not follow desired style or formatting for indentation, white space, comments, etc.

cwe.name: Parent Class without Virtual Destructor Method
cwe.description: A parent class contains one or more child classes, but the parent class does not have a virtual destructor method.

cwe.name: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code
cwe.description: A source code file has too many lines of code.

cwe.name: Class Instance Self Destruction Control Element
cwe.description: The code contains a class instance that calls the method or function to delete or destroy itself.

cwe.name: Data Access from Outside Expected Data Manager Component
cwe.description: The product is intended to manage data access through a particular data manager component such as a relational or non-SQL database, but it contains code that performs data access operations without using that component.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element with Excessive File or Data Access Operations
cwe.description: A function or method contains too many operations that utilize a data manager or file resource.

cwe.name: Invokable Control Element with Excessive Volume of Commented-out Code
cwe.description: A function, method, procedure, etc. contains an excessive amount of code that has been commented out within its body.

cwe.name: Class with Excessive Number of Child Classes
cwe.description: A class contains an unnecessarily large number of children.

cwe.name: Class with Virtual Method without a Virtual Destructor
cwe.description: A class contains a virtual method, but the method does not have an associated virtual destructor.

cwe.name: Synchronous Access of Remote Resource without Timeout
cwe.description: The code has a synchronous call to a remote resource, but there is no timeout for the call, or the timeout is set to infinite.

cwe.name: Large Data Table with Excessive Number of Indices
cwe.description: The product uses a large data table that contains an excessively large number of indices.

cwe.name: Method Containing Access of a Member Element from Another Class
cwe.description: A method for a class performs an operation that directly accesses a member element from another class.

cwe.name: Use of Object without Invoking Destructor Method
cwe.description: The product contains a method that accesses an object but does not later invoke the element's associated finalize/destructor method.

cwe.name: Use of Same Invokable Control Element in Multiple Architectural Layers
cwe.description: The product uses the same control element across multiple architectural layers.

cwe.name: Excessively Complex Data Representation
cwe.description: The product uses an unnecessarily complex internal representation for its data structures or interrelationships between those structures.

cwe.name: Excessive Index Range Scan for a Data Resource
cwe.description: The product contains an index range scan for a large data table, but the scan can cover a large number of rows.

cwe.name: Loop Condition Value Update within the Loop
cwe.description: The product uses a loop with a control flow condition based on a value that is updated within the body of the loop.

cwe.name: Singleton Class Instance Creation without Proper Locking or Synchronization
cwe.description: The product implements a Singleton design pattern but does not use appropriate locking or other synchronization mechanism to ensure that the singleton class is only instantiated once.

cwe.name: Persistent Storable Data Element without Associated Comparison Control Element
cwe.description: The product uses a storable data element that does not have all of the associated functions or methods that are necessary to support comparison.

cwe.name: Data Element containing Pointer Item without Proper Copy Control Element
cwe.description: The code contains a data element with a pointer that does not have an associated copy or constructor method.

cwe.name: Inconsistent Naming Conventions for Identifiers
cwe.description: The product's code, documentation, or other artifacts do not consistently use the same naming conventions for variables, callables, groups of related callables, I/O capabilities, data types, file names, or similar types of elements.

cwe.name: Insufficient Isolation of System-Dependent Functions
cwe.description: The product or code does not isolate system-dependent functionality into separate standalone modules.

cwe.name: Reliance on Runtime Component in Generated Code
cwe.description: The product uses automatically-generated code that cannot be executed without a specific runtime support component.

cwe.name: Reliance on Machine-Dependent Data Representation
cwe.description: The code uses a data representation that relies on low-level data representation or constructs that may vary across different processors, physical machines, OSes, or other physical components.

cwe.name: Use of Platform-Dependent Third Party Components
cwe.description: The product relies on third-party components that do not provide equivalent functionality across all desirable platforms.

cwe.name: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
cwe.description: The product relies on third-party components that are not actively supported or maintained by the original developer or a trusted proxy for the original developer.

cwe.name: Insufficient Encapsulation of Machine-Dependent Functionality
cwe.description: The product or code uses machine-dependent functionality, but it does not sufficiently encapsulate or isolate this functionality from the rest of the code.

cwe.name: Insufficient Use of Symbolic Constants
cwe.description: The source code uses literal constants that may need to change or evolve over time, instead of using symbolic constants.

cwe.name: Insufficient Isolation of Symbolic Constant Definitions
cwe.description: The source code uses symbolic constants, but it does not sufficiently place the definitions of these constants into a more centralized or isolated location.

cwe.name: Excessive Reliance on Global Variables
cwe.description: The code is structured in a way that relies too much on using or setting global variables throughout various points in the code, instead of preserving the associated information in a narrower, more local context.

cwe.name: Use of Same Variable for Multiple Purposes
cwe.description: The code contains a callable, block, or other code element in which the same variable is used to control more than one unique task or store more than one instance of data.

cwe.name: Incomplete Design Documentation
cwe.description: The product's design documentation does not adequately describe control flow, data flow, system initialization, relationships between tasks, components, rationales, or other important aspects of the design.

cwe.name: Incomplete I/O Documentation
cwe.description: The product's documentation does not adequately define inputs, outputs, or system/software interfaces.

cwe.name: Incomplete Documentation of Program Execution
cwe.description: The document does not fully define all mechanisms that are used to control or influence how product-specific programs are executed.

cwe.name: Inappropriate Comment Style
cwe.description: The source code uses comment styles or formats that are inconsistent or do not follow expected standards for the product.

cwe.name: Inappropriate Whitespace Style
cwe.description: The source code contains whitespace that is inconsistent across the code or does not follow expected standards for the product.

cwe.name: Source Code Element without Standard Prologue
cwe.description: The source code contains elements such as source files that do not consistently provide a prologue or header that has been standardized for the project.

cwe.name: Inaccurate Comments
cwe.description: The source code contains comments that do not accurately describe or explain aspects of the portion of the code with which the comment is associated.

cwe.name: Callable with Insufficient Behavioral Summary
cwe.description: The code contains a function or method whose signature and/or associated inline documentation does not sufficiently describe the callable's inputs, outputs, side effects, assumptions, or return codes.

cwe.name: Insufficient Documentation of Error Handling Techniques
cwe.description: The documentation does not sufficiently describe the techniques that are used for error handling, exception processing, or similar mechanisms.

cwe.name: Excessive Use of Unconditional Branching
cwe.description: The code uses too many unconditional branches (such as "goto").

cwe.name: Excessive Code Complexity
